repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Small and Medium Industrial
            Enterprise Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Small and Medium Industrial Enterprise
            (SMIE) Project in Indonesia. The project's main
            objective was to increase the supply of unsubsidized term
            finance and high-quality technical assistance to qualified
            small and medium industrial enterprises (SMIEs). Bank’s
            performance was deficient.  Borrower Performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            the project has been too ambitious in terms of its multiple
            objectives and institutions involved; (ii) be very selective
            in the choice of participating financial intermediaries
            based on strong institutional capacities in delivering
            credit and related services to designated beneficiary firms,
            and on a clear understanding of their funding strategy and
            constraints for delivering term finance to the beneficiary
            firms; (iii) choose formula for determining on lending rates
            in domestic currency, of Bank funds to financial
            intermediaries which are based on current market rates of
            alternative banks' funding sources; and (iv) In Bank
            supervision, combine and integrate as much as possible the
            supervision of Bank projects with similar participating
            institutions and beneficiaries.

5078713.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Small and Medium Industrial
            Enterprise Project

abstracts.cdata!:
By providing high quality,
            cost-effective technical assistance and unsubsidized term
            credit, the Small and Medium Industrial Enterprise Project
            will help develop the small and medium enterprise (SMIE)
            segment of industrial enterprises. The project consists of
            an investment credit component and a technical assistance
            component. Term credit at market rates will be channelled
            through 13 participating banks to support approximately 700
            subprojects to enable them to modernize, expand, and
            diversify in response to the improved economic environment.
            The technical assistance component will establish and
            implement an enterprise level assistance program to enable
            SMIEs to prepare high quality investment proposals.
